GSD.description: A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to overwrite and possibly corrupt files on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting arbitrary commands that are executed as the root user account. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to overwrite arbitrary system files, which could result in a denial of service (DoS) condition.

CVE_data_meta.TITLE: Cisco SD-WAN Software Arbitrary File Corruption Vulnerability

description_data.value: A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco SD-WAN Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to overwrite and possibly corrupt files on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by injecting arbitrary commands that are executed as the root user account. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to overwrite arbitrary system files, which could result in a denial of service (DoS) condition.

exploit.value: The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

reference_data.name: 20220928 Cisco SD-WAN Software Arbitrary File Corruption Vulnerability
